pageContext.claim: “Thanks to our tremendous tax cuts -- the biggest -- Minnesota families are saving more than $5 billion on their 2018 tax bills. Five billion.”
pageContext.analysis: H&R Block data showed that taxes in Minnesota decreased by 23.4% in 2018, which using an older calculation for total federal taxes paid suggests Minnesota residents may have paid around $6 billion fewer taxes. But it’s not clear exactly where Trump got this statistic. When asked about his sourcing, the president responded it was “according to whoever does that kind of thing.”
